summary: Email chain between attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, arranging a meeting in West Palm Beach to discuss a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) who was served with a grand jury subpoena in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss scheduling a call and an in-person meeting, and mention a proffer letter.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney from ROSS AMSEL RABEN NASCIMENTO, PLLC, arranging a meeting with federal prosecutors to discuss a client who was served with a grand jury subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to indirectly as the client formerly represented by Alan Ross and now the subject of a grand jury subpoena served to an agent.

connections.description: Nascimento is acting as counsel, arranging a meeting with prosecutors regarding the grand jury subpoena served to Maxwell's agent.
Nascimento was Ross's former law partner and is now the Florida Bar appointed inventory attorney for his practice.
Alan Ross previously represented Ghislaine Maxwell prior to his death in 2018.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: An agent of Ghislaine Maxwell was served with a grand jury subpoena by the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Attorneys arranged to meet at the Hilton in West Palm Beach to discuss the subpoena and case.

locations: Hilton, 600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: An agent of Ghislaine Maxwell was served with a grand jury subpoena by the SDNY on July 6, 2019.
Attorney Joseph Nascimento, acting for Maxwell, was arranging a proffer meeting with federal prosecutors in July 2019.
The emails show coordination for a meeting at the Hilton in West Palm Beach, indicating active investigation and negotiation post-Epstein's arrest.
The correspondence references a proffer letter, indicating potential cooperation discussions.
Alan Ross, Maxwell's former attorney who died in 2018, is mentioned, showing continuity of legal representation.
